game_description: A Bird's peaceful summer slumber is disturbed by the majestic call of a mysterious Owl. Enticed to swallow the last piece of the waning Moon, Bird is blown far from its Golden Gate home. Unscramble celestial puzzles and create miniature musical worlds. Re-awaken shadowy forests and bring life back to sparkling lakes. Discover hidden creatures, help the Bird reunite the fragmented Moon... and find its way home. Brought to you by Funomenaâ€™s uniquely diverse team of veteran developers (Journey, Flower, Boom Blox, The Sims 2) Luna is an interactive fable about learning by the light of unexpected mistakes. Solve celestial puzzles to unlock each level's tree, plant and animal spirits. Place, customize and interact with them in miniature, musical terrariums. Bring each world to life, revealing Austin Wintoryâ€™s haunting, enchanting score.
review_1: I absolutely love this little game ðŸ’– So lovely and sweet !
review_2: My daughter loved this game until the last level, when you're supposed to draw a circle around the moon.. It's here that the game totally glitches and won't let her complete it. Very frustrating for a game that is supposed to be relaxing. :(
review_3: It's cute, and fun to place things in the little scenes but the same activity over and over I got bored. When I connected the stars and pinch it to awaken it sometimes it takes a loooong time to activate and it's frustrating. Predictable and repetitious. I was expecting something else I guess. Disappointed.
review_4: This is such a hidden gem! At the time of my writing, this game has just 28 reviews - how is that possible? The graphics are beautiful, the narrator is perfect and the experience itself is just amazing! The game is something between a puzzle game and an interactive story. Just buy it, itâ€™s great!
review_5: I downloaded this several days before I played it. I work in Healthcare and my empathy was waning. On a whim I opened Luna and started to follow the story. It restored my empathy and I found it completely enchanting. Even though I went through the whole thing, I will return to Luna again. A wonderful story, well told and well presented.
